intro: Baskervilla venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan baskervilla, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open grasslands and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
